alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Marengo; Perry; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:16AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Marengo, southwestern Perry, southern Dallas and southern Sumter Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 116 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near York to near Orrville. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Livingston, York, Linden, Uniontown, Cuba, Jefferson, Thomaston, Orrville, Myrtlewood, Dayton, Bogue Chitto, Consul, Dannelly Reservoir, Boyd, Dallas Lake, Coatopa, Kinterbish, The University Of West Alabama and Central Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Alabama.
